actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide that an individual's entitlement to benefits thereunder shall continue through the month of his or her death (except where the consequent delay in survivor eligibility would reduce total family benefits).
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Provides, that an individual's entitlement to benefits under title II of the Social Security Act (Old-Age, Survivors', and Disability Benefits), shall continue through the month of his or her death (except where the consequent delay in survivor eligibility would reduce total family benefits).

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide that an individual's entitlement to benefits thereunder shall continue through the month of his or her death (except where the consequent delay in survivor eligibility would reduce total family benefits).
